Topics: Motility demonstration: Hanging drop, wet mount preparation, semi-solid agar, Craigie’s tube method.
Staining techniques: Smear preparation, permanent specimen preparation, capsular, and acid-fast staining
Direct counts – Direct cell count (Petroff-Hausser counting chamber), turbidometry.
Viable count - pour plate, spread plate.

Units.Unit_Name: Bacterial Count Using Different Methods And Anaerobic Culture
Topics: Antibiotic sensitivity testing: Disc diffusion test - Quality control with standard strains.

Units.Unit_Name: Morphological Demonstration Of Microorganisms And Identification
Topics: Morphological variations in algae, fungi and protozoa.
Micrometry: Demonstration of the size of yeast, fungal filaments and protozoa.
Methods of Bacterial Identification - Morphological, physiological, and biochemical methods - IMViC test, H S, TSI, 2 oxidase, catalase, urease test, and carbohydrate fermentation test.
Maintenance of pure culture, paraffin method, stab culture, maintenance of mold culture.
